column1: Svay Rieng (Khmer: ស្វាយរៀង
column3: "Aligned Mangoes") is a province (khaet) of Cambodia. Located in the southeast
column5: which surrounds it to the north
column6: east and south.  The only other Cambodian province to border Svay Rieng is Prey Veng. The capital is Svay Rieng while the largest city is Bavet
column7: which is the international border between Cambodia and Vietnam.

column1: The province is subdivided into 6 districts and 2 municipalities.
These 6 districts and 2 municipalities are subdivided into 80 khums and 690 phums.
A portion of the province juts into Vietnam
Svay Rieng Province is the birthplace of the Cambodian coconut dance.  It originated around 1960 in Romeas Haek District.  The dance is a performance with coconuts involving men and women.
